FuncDef:
The rip pkt-transmit command sets the interval at which update packets are sent by a specified interface and the number of packets sent each time.
The undo rip pkt-transmit command restores the default setting. The rip pkt-transmit command sets the interval at which update packets are sent by a specified interface and the number of packets sent each time. The undo rip pkt-transmit command restores the default setting. By default, interval, pkt-count, and bandwidth-value are 200 milliseconds, 50, and 99, respectively.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval for sending packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 500 milliseconds.

Indicates the number of packets sent each time.
The value is an integer ranging from 25 to 100.

Specifies the percentage of the bandwidth for sending RIP packets to the total bandwidth.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 99.
